intro: Cacalia erioclada, commonly known as the hairy cacalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the familyApiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Cacalia erioclada is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
